Package com.intellij.openapi.roots

Interface ContentEntry

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Synthetic
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContentEntryImpl, JpsContentEntry

    public interface ContentEntry
extends Synthetic
    Represents a module's content root. You can get existing entries with ModuleRootModel.getContentEntries() or create a new one with ModifiableRootModel.addContentEntry(VirtualFile).
    See Also:
    ModuleRootModel.getContentEntries(), ModifiableRootModel.addContentEntry(VirtualFile)

    • Method Detail

      • getFile

        VirtualFile getFile()
        Returns the root file or directory for the content root, if it is valid.
        Returns:
        the content root file or directory, or null if content entry is invalid.

      • getUrl

        java.lang.String getUrl()
        Returns the URL of content root. To validate returned roots, use VirtualFileManager.findFileByUrl(String)
        Returns:
        URL of content root, that should never be null.

      • getSourceFolders

        SourceFolder [] getSourceFolders()
        Returns the list of source roots under this content root.
        Returns:
        list of this ContentEntry SourceFolders

      • getSourceFolders

        java.util.List<SourceFolder> getSourceFolders(JpsModuleSourceRootType<?> rootType)
        Parameters:
        rootType - type of accepted source roots
        Returns:
        list of source roots of the specified type containing in this content root

      • getSourceFolders

        java.util.List<SourceFolder> getSourceFolders(java.util.Set<? extends JpsModuleSourceRootType<?>> rootTypes)
        Parameters:
        rootTypes - types of accepted source roots
        Returns:
        list of source roots of the specified types containing in this content root

      • getSourceFolderFiles

        VirtualFile [] getSourceFolderFiles()
        Returns the list of files and directories for valid source roots under this content root.
        Returns:
        list of all valid source roots.

      • getExcludeFolders

        ExcludeFolder [] getExcludeFolders()
        Returns the list of excluded roots configured under this content root. The result doesn't include synthetic excludes like the module output.
        Returns:
        list of this ContentEntry ExcludeFolders

      • getExcludeFolderUrls

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExcludeFolderUrls()
        Returns:
        list of URLs for all excluded roots under this content root including synthetic excludes like the module output

      • getExcludeFolderFiles

        VirtualFile [] getExcludeFolderFiles()
        Returns the list of files and directories for valid excluded roots under this content root.
        Returns:
        list of all valid exclude roots including synthetic excludes like the module output

      • addSourceFolder

        SourceFolder addSourceFolder(VirtualFile file,
                             boolean isTestSource)
        Adds a source or test source root under the content root.
        Parameters:
        file - the file or directory to add as a source root.
        isTestSource - true if the file or directory is added as a test source root.
        Returns:
        the object representing the added root.

      • addSourceFolder

        SourceFolder addSourceFolder(VirtualFile file,
                             boolean isTestSource,
                             java.lang.String packagePrefix)
        Adds a source or test source root with the specified package prefix under the content root.
        Parameters:
        file - the file or directory to add as a source root.
        isTestSource - true if the file or directory is added as a test source root.
        packagePrefix - the package prefix for the root to add, or an empty string if no package prefix is required.
        Returns:
        the object representing the added root.

      • removeExcludeFolder

        boolean removeExcludeFolder(java.lang.String url)
        Removes an exclude root from this content root.
        Parameters:
        url - url of the exclude root
        Returns:
        true if the exclude root was removed

      • clearExcludeFolders

        void clearExcludeFolders()

      • getExcludePatterns

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExcludePatterns()
        Returns patterns for names of files which should be excluded from this content root. If name of a file under this content root matches any of the patterns it'll be excluded from the module, if name of a directory matches any of the patterns the directory and all of its contents will be excluded. '?' and '*' wildcards are supported.

      • addExcludePattern

        void addExcludePattern(java.lang.String pattern)

      • removeExcludePattern

        void removeExcludePattern(java.lang.String pattern)

      • setExcludePatterns

        void setExcludePatterns(java.util.List<java.lang.String> patterns)
